newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian bonds end soft ahead of new bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Austrian bonds end soft ahead of new bond issue.

text.p: 1530 GMT - Austrian bonds ended weaker in hectic trade ahead of the weekend, with the short end of the market under pressure after the announcement of a new five year issue on Tuesday, traders said.
"It was chaotic today. The whole short end came under pressure," said one trader.
An additional factor weighing on the market was the uncertainty over the Fed meeting on Tuesday, which traders fear could result in a U.S. rate hike.
Traders said there was little upside potential for the time being.
"I think the German Bund future has seen its high at 102.50," said another trader.
* 10 year benchmark 5.75 pct bond maturing July 2006 down up 10 bps at 100.60 to yield 5.67 (5.68) pct in bourse trade, quoted post-market at 99.84/92 to yield 5.77/76.
* Latest five-year 4.375 bond maturing February 2002 closed down 15 bps at 98.85 in bourse trade to yield 4.60 (4.57) pct, quoted post-market at 98.55/63 to yield 4.67/65 percent.
* Austrian bond future up four bps at 109.44 on turnover of 382 lots.
* 10-year spread over Germany up one at zero, five-year spread down five bps at 10.
* Money market rates steady with three-month VIBOR lower at 3.437 and overnight money higher at 3.15/3.40. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112 257
